messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### countSubstrings 
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    t = '^#' + '#'.join(s) + '#$'   # --- py stmt 3
    n = len(t)   # --- py stmt 4
    p = [0 for _ in range(n)]   # --- py stmt 5
    pos, maxRight = 0, 0   # --- py stmt 6
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 7
    for i in range(1, n - 1):   # --- py stmt 8
        p[i] = min(maxRight - i, p[2 * pos - i]) if maxRight > i else 1   # --- py stmt 9
        while t[i - p[i]] == t[i + p[i]]:   # --- py stmt 10
            p[i] += 1   # --- py stmt 11
        if i + p[i] > maxRight:   # --- py stmt 12
            maxRight = i + p[i]   # --- py stmt 13
            pos = i   # --- py stmt 14
        ans += p[i] // 2   # --- py stmt 15
    return ans   # --- py stmt 16
### decrypt 
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(code: List[int], k: int) -> List[int]:   # --- py stmt 2
    n = len(code)   # --- py stmt 3
    res = [0] * n   # --- py stmt 4
    if k == 0:   # --- py stmt 5
        return res   # --- py stmt 6
    for i in range(n):   # --- py stmt 7
        if k > 0:   # --- py stmt 8
            for j in range(i + 1, i + k + 1):   # --- py stmt 9
                res[i] += code[j % n]   # --- py stmt 10
        else:   # --- py stmt 11
            for j in range(i + k, i):   # --- py stmt 12
                res[i] += code[(j + n) % n]   # --- py stmt 13
    return res   # --- py stmt 14
### multiply 
from collections import defaultdict   # --- py stmt 1
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 2
def f_gold(mat1: List[List[int]], mat2: List[List[int]]) -> List[List[int]]:   # --- py stmt 3
    r1, c1, c2 = len(mat1), len(mat1[0]), len(mat2[0])   # --- py stmt 4
    res = [[0] * c2 for _ in range(r1)]   # --- py stmt 5
    mp = defaultdict(list)   # --- py stmt 6
    for i in range(r1):   # --- py stmt 7
        for j in range(c1):   # --- py stmt 8
            if mat1[i][j] != 0:   # --- py stmt 9
                mp[i].append(j)   # --- py stmt 10
    for i in range(r1):   # --- py stmt 11
        for j in range(c2):   # --- py stmt 12
            for k in mp[i]:   # --- py stmt 13
                res[i][j] += mat1[i][k] * mat2[k][j]   # --- py stmt 14
    return res   # --- py stmt 15
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function f_gold(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var t = '^#' + '#'.join(s) + '#$';   // --- py stmt 3
    var n = t.length;   // --- py stmt 4
    var p = new Array(n);   // --- py stmt 5
    var pos = 0;   // --- py stmt 6
    var maxRight = 0;   // --- py stmt 6
    var ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 7
    for (var i = 1; i < n - 1; i++) {   // --- py stmt 8
        p[i] = (maxRight > i) ? Math.min(maxRight - i, p[2 * pos - i]) : 1;   // --- py stmt 9
        while (t[i - p[i]] == t[i + p[i]]) {   // --- py stmt 10
            p[i] += 1;   // --- py stmt 11
        }
        if (i + p[i] > maxRight) {   // --- py stmt 12
            maxRight = i + p[i];   // --- py stmt 13
            pos = i;   // --- py stmt 14
        }
        ans += p[i] / 2;   // --- py stmt 15
    }
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 16
}


function f_gold(code, k) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var n = code.length;   // --- py stmt 3
    var res = [0] * n;   // --- py stmt 4
    if (k == 0) {   // --- py stmt 5
        return res;   // --- py stmt 6
    }
    for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {   // --- py stmt 7
        if (k > 0) {   // --- py stmt 8
            for (var j = i + 1; j < i + k + 1; j++) {   // --- py stmt 9
                res[i] += code[j % n];   // --- py stmt 10
            }
        }
        else {   // --- py stmt 11
            for (var j = i + k; j < i; j++) {   // --- py stmt 12
                res[i] += code[(j + n) % n];   // --- py stmt 13
            }
        }
    }
    return res;   // --- py stmt 14
}


function f_gold(mat1, mat2) {   // --- py stmt 3
    var r1 = mat1.length;   // --- py stmt 4
    var c1 = mat1[0].length;   // --- py stmt 4
    var c2 = mat2[0].length;   // --- py stmt 4
    var res = new Array(r1);   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var i = 0; i < r1; i++) {   // --- py stmt 5
        res[i] = new Array(c2);   // --- py stmt 5
        for (var j = 0; j < c2; j++) {   // --- py stmt 5
            res[i][j] = 0;   // --- py stmt 5
        }
    }
    var mp = new Map();   // --- py stmt 6
    for (var i = 0; i < r1; i++) {   // --- py stmt 7
        for (var j = 0; j < c1; j++) {   // --- py stmt 8
            if (mat1[i][j] != 0) {   // --- py stmt 9
                if (mp.has(i)) {   // --- py stmt 10
                    mp.get(i).push(j);   // --- py stmt 11
                } else {
                    mp.set(i, [j]);   // --- py stmt 12
                }
            }
        }
    }
    for (var i = 0; i < r1; i++) {   // --- py stmt 13
        for (var j = 0; j < c2; j++) {   // --- py stmt 14
            for (var k = 0; k < mp.get(i).length; k++) {   // --- py stmt 15
                res[i][j] += mat1[i][mp.get(i)[k]] * mat2[mp.get(i)[k]][j];   // --- py stmt 16
            }
        }
    }
    return res;   // --- py stmt 17
}
```
